<<<api>>>: Process.getInputStream()
<<<code>>>: Process p = Runtime.getRuntime().exec("mvn integration-test -DskipTests -P interactive -e");
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(p.getInputStream()));
String line = in.readLine();
System.out.println(line);
<<<explanation>>>: You can use ProcessBuilder to create the process and then get the input stream.
Question: How to get the current time in milliseconds?:I want to get the current time in milliseconds. I have tried this:System.currentTimeMillis() but it returns the time in seconds.
Please using this api: System.currentTimeMillis.
Answer:<<<api>>>: System.currentTimeMillis()
<<<code>>>: long time = System.currentTimeMillis();
<<<explanation>>>: You can use Calendar to get the current time in milliseconds.
